greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Delete all digits 3 from the terms of the sequence of nonnegative integers.
comment: Very similar to A004178, except that 3-repdigits (A002277) are completely removed from the sequence, whereas A004178 has 0's in their place. It is thus guaranteed that a(n) = n only when n < 3. - _Alonso del Arte_, Oct 18 2012
link: Alonso del Arte, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
formula: a(n) = A004178(n + 4) for 3329 < n < 33329, etc. - _Alonso del Arte_, Oct 21 2012
mathematica: endAt = 103; Delete[Table[FromDigits[DeleteCases[IntegerDigits[n], 3]], {n, 0, endAt}], Table[{(10^expo - 1)/3 + 1}, {expo, Floor[Log[10, endAt]]}]] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 29 2019 *)
program: return 2 if k == m else int(str(k).replace('3','')) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Apr 20 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: _Sean A. Irvine_ pointed out erroneous terms in b-file and confirmed correction, Apr 28 2019
